title: [Self-directed] Online Help System Evaluation and Utilization Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Computer-based problem-solving experience and software tool usage experience
context.additional_context: Program for Graduate Students in Science Fields Focused on Cultivating the Ability to Evaluate and Analyze Online Help Systems Through Microlearning Delivered in Mobile Environments

learning_goals: Learners can evaluate the user-friendliness and information structuring level of online help systems with 90% accuracy
Learners can apply and explain three or more online help system evaluation checklist items based on problem-solving efficiency criteria
Learners can analyze the usefulness of online help systems on a 5-point scale while solving real-world problems using given science domain software tools

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) mobile devices

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
